title: HTML Introduction
summary: Learn the basics of HTML structure and tags.
description: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the foundation of web development. In this lesson, you'll learn about HTML structure, basic tags, and how to create your first webpage.

slides.title: What is HTML?
slides.content:
What is HTML?

HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the foundation of web development.

It's the standard markup language for creating web pages.

slides.title: HTML Structure
slides.content:
HTML Structure

HTML describes the structure of a web page using markup.

<h1>Hello World</h1>

slides.title: Key Concepts
slides.content:
Key Concepts

  • HTML elements are building blocks
  • Tags define content structure
  • Attributes provide additional information

slides.title: Your First HTML Page
slides.content:
Your First HTML Page

Let's create a simple HTML page together!

Click 'Next' to start coding!

learningObjectives: Understand what HTML is and its purpose

title: HTML Document Structure
summary: Learn about HTML document structure and semantic elements.
description: Understanding the proper structure of an HTML document is crucial for creating well-formed web pages.

slides.title: HTML Document Structure
slides.content:
HTML Document Structure

Every HTML document has a specific structure that browsers understand.

This structure is essential for creating well-formed web pages.

slides.title: Essential Elements
slides.content:
Essential Elements

  • DOCTYPE declaration
  • html root element
  • head section (metadata)
  • body section (visible content)

slides.title: Semantic Elements
slides.content:
Semantic Elements

Use semantic elements to give meaning to your content:

  • <header> - Page header
  • <main> - Main content
  • <article> - Article content
  • <footer> - Page footer

exercise.starter:

hints: Always include DOCTYPE html
Use semantic elements like header, main, article, footer
Include meta tags for character encoding and viewport

title: Links and Images
summary: Learn how to add links and images to your web pages.
description: Links and images are essential for creating engaging web pages. Learn how to add them properly.

slides.title: Adding Links and Images
slides.content:
Adding Links and Images

Links connect pages together, and images make content visually appealing.

These elements are essential for creating engaging web pages.

slides.title: Creating Links
slides.content:
Creating Links

Use the <a> tag to create hyperlinks:

<a href='https://example.com'>Visit Example</a>

slides.title: Adding Images
slides.content:
Adding Images

Use the <img> tag to add images:

<img src='image.jpg' alt='Description'>

slides.title: Link Types
slides.content:
Link Types

  • External links: href='https://example.com'
  • Internal links: href='#section'
  • Email links: href='mailto:email@example.com'

exercise.starter:

hints: Use href attribute for links
Always include alt attribute for images
Use # for internal page links

title: CSS Introduction
summary: Learn the basics of CSS styling and how to make your pages beautiful.
description: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) controls the visual appearance of your web pages. Learn how to style text, colors, and layouts.
content:
What is CSS?

CSS is a stylesheet language used to describe the presentation of HTML documents.

Key Concepts:

  • Selectors target HTML elements
  • Properties define styling rules
  • Values specify how properties should look
learningObjectives: Understand what CSS is and its purpose
Apply basic styling to HTML elements

exercise.description: Style your HTML page with colors, fonts, and basic layout.
exercise.starter:
Welcome to CSS!

This paragraph is styled with CSS.

CSS makes web pages look beautiful!
hints: Use style tag in head section
Target elements with selectors
Use color names or hex codes for colors

title: Colors and Fonts
summary: Master colors and typography in CSS.
description: Learn how to use colors and fonts effectively to create visually appealing web pages.
content:
Colors and Typography

Colors and fonts are fundamental to good web design.

Color Options:

  • Color names (red, blue, green)
  • Hex codes (#FF0000)
  • RGB values (rgb(255,0,0))

Font Properties:

  • font-family for typeface
  • font-size for text size
  • font-weight for boldness
learningObjectives: Use different color formats in CSS

exercise.starter:

hints: Use gradient backgrounds for visual appeal
Combine different font properties
Use classes for reusable styles

title: CSS Layout Basics
summary: Learn CSS layout properties like margin, padding, and positioning.
description: Understanding CSS layout is crucial for creating well-structured web pages. Learn about the box model and positioning.
content:
CSS Layout and Box Model

Every HTML element is a box with content, padding, border, and margin.

Box Model Components:

  • Content: The actual content
  • Padding: Space inside the element
  • Border: Line around the element
  • Margin: Space outside the element

hints: Use box-sizing: border-box for easier calculations
Center content with margin: auto
Use padding for internal spacing

title: JavaScript Introduction
summary: Learn the basics of JavaScript programming and how to make pages interactive.
description: JavaScript is the programming language that makes web pages interactive. Learn variables, functions, and basic programming concepts.
content:
What is JavaScript?

JavaScript is a programming language that adds interactivity to web pages.

Key Concepts:

  • Variables store data
  • Functions perform actions
  • Events respond to user interactions
learningObjectives: Learn about variables and data types

exercise.starter:

hints: Use onclick attribute for button events
Access elements with getElementById
Use innerHTML to change content

title: Variables and Data Types
summary: Learn about JavaScript variables and different data types.
description: Variables are containers for storing data. Learn about different data types and how to use them effectively.
content:
Variables and Data Types

Variables store different types of data in JavaScript.

Data Types:

  • Numbers: 42, 3.14
  • Strings: 'Hello World'
  • Booleans: true, false
  • Arrays: [1, 2, 3]
  • Objects: {name: 'John'}
learningObjectives: Declare variables with let, const, and var

hints: Use parseFloat() to convert strings to numbers
Store values in variables before using them
Use template literals for string formatting

title: Functions and Events
summary: Learn how to create functions and handle user events.
description: Functions are reusable blocks of code, and events make your pages interactive. Learn how to combine them effectively.
content:
Functions and Events

Functions allow you to organize code into reusable blocks, and events make pages interactive.

Function Types:

  • Function declarations
  • Function expressions
  • Arrow functions

Common Events:

  • click - mouse clicks
  • keydown - keyboard presses
  • load - page loads
